info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 6 at 3:05AM CDT until May 6 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, Irion and Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near Knickerbocker moving into San Angelo and Vancourt moving northeast. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Mertzon, Paint Rock, Christoval, Wall, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Veribest, Vancourt, Lake Nasworthy, Mereta, Eola, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Twin Buttes Reservoir, San Angelo State Park, Orient, Lowake, Grape Creek, Knickerbocker, Tankersley and Carlsbad. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 1929 crossing Fuzzy Creek, FM 1692 crossing The Draw, Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek and FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Concho, TX; Irion, TX; Tom Green, TX
